intro: Neonauclea lanceolata subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender lanceleaf neonauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
